comment: Very particular man! Has a huge deviation from the rest of 1001 studios, but offers a unique challenge and good feedback. Pretty much forces you to get used to heavy experimentation. He's very flexible (except deadlines) and encourages mingling with peers. Frank is pretty laid back and will vouch for his students.

I loved having Frank! It did take some adjusting to the workload of Architecture so my grade reflects that. Extremely understanding to life events and only grades you on 3 projects (can make or break your grade)
Just have everything on his grading rubic
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I took Frank for both Dcomm 1 & 2. He explains the work very well, and records his lectures in case you need go back. It's a lot of work, and he won't let you submit after the deadline but that's a good thing. He's available to meet online or in person most days, and truly wants you to succeed. He is very detail oriented and expects the best work.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: He gives pretty good feedback. He's not a very hands-on guy, you have to take your work to him to get his feedback or else, you'll get stuck. He just tries to help you build your ideas. He follows his grading rubric too.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Frank is an awesome teacher when it comes to working with rhino and adobe products. He records his lectures so you're able to go back and look at them. He gives great feedback on your work and he's always helpful.

Professor Frank is a great instructor! Very well versed in Revit, very easy to understand his lectures and follow along. Gives good feedback and is there to help. There were breakout rooms to check up on your progress or for questions. Make sure you log into class for attendance and no extensions on deadlines. Would definitely take his class again.

Great Prof, he was very straightforward while grading, always open to questions and gave great feedback. The assignments were not hard at all, he took us step-to-step on how to do it so that made it easy.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is a VERY difficult professor for DCOM 1. Students who take this class with him typically take it to be challenged. You learn a ton of information at a fast pace. But if you work hard you will have a great knowledge base to help in upper years. However... If you miss one class he knocks off 2 points from your grade. So don't skip, You'll fail..
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.
